Katharine Anderson - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., History - 1995

Advisor: Harold Perkin

Field: Modern British History of Science, Published book based upon Dissertation: Predicting the Weather: Victorians and the Science of Meteorology, Current Position: Professor of History, York University, Ontario, Canada

Chernoh Bah - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., History - 2023

Advisor: Helen Tilley

Dissertation: “Resolving an Empire Problem: Public Health, Convict Labor, and the Revenue Crisis in Colonial Sierra Leone, 1914-1944", Education: B.A. in History, Sociology, and Diploma in African Studies, Fourah Bay College, Sierra Leone.

Bonnie Ernst - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., History - 2018

Advisor: Ken Alder

Dissertation: “Women in the Age of Mass Incarceration: Gender, Rights, and Punishment in Michigan”, Education: M.A., Criminology and Criminal Justice, University of Oxford, B.S., History, University of Chicago Current Position: Assistant Professor of Sociology and Criminology and Law, University of Florida

Mary Beth Finch - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Sociology - 2015

Advisor: Carol Heimer

Fields: Morality, Consumers and Consumption, Culture, Religion, Gender and Qualitive Methods, Dissertation: "Selling Fair Trade: Markets, Morality and Ambiguity", Education: M.A., Sociology, Northwestern University, B.A., Sociology, University of Missouri - Columbia, Current Position: Visiting Assistant Professor, Northwestern University

J. Lynn Gazley - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Sociology - 1999

Advisor: Carol Heimer

Field: Medical Sociology, Dissertation: "Our Particular Patients: Local Relevance in Clinical Research", Current Position: Assistant Professor, Sociology and Anthropology, College of New Jersey

Bernard Geoghegan - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., School of Communications - 2012

Advisors: Sam Weber and Ken Alder

Field: History of the Information Sciences, Dissertation: "The Cybernetic Apparatus: Media, Liberalism, and the Reform of Human Sciences", Fellowship: Research Fellowship, Institute for Cultural History and Theory, Humboldt University of Berlin (2011-16), Current Position: Senior Lecturer, History and Theory of Digital Media, Kings College, London

Marcel Knudsen - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Sociology - 2018

Advisor: Leslie McCall and Robert Nelson

Field: Work and Inequality, Organizations, Dissertation: "What's in a Wage: Minimum Wage Increases and Workplace Hierarchies in the Restaurant Industry", Education: M.A., Sociology, Northwestern University, B.A., Sociology and Economics, University of Chicago, Current Position: People Analytics Leader, Xerox Corporation

Elizabeth Koselka - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Anthropology - 2023

Advisor: William Leonard

Dissertation: "Logics of Eating in Alicante, Spain: Biosocial Relationships Connecting Migration, Food, Stress, and Health", Education: BA University of Wisconsin, Current Position: U.S. Fulbright Postdoctoral Fellow in Spain

Jacob Henry Leveton - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Art History - 2021

Advisor: Stephen F. Eisenman

Field: Global Modern and Contemporary Art, Dissertation: "William Blake's Radical Ecology", Current Position: Program Coordinator, Institute for Humanities Research, Arizona State University

Gemma Mangione - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Sociology - 2016

Advisor: Wendy Griswold

Field: Culture, Health and Illness, Dissertation: "Making Sense of Things: Access and The Therapeutic Turn in Museum Gardens and Galleries", Fellowship: American Association of University Women (2015), Education: M.A., Sociology, B.S., Journalism and Art History, Northwestern University, Current Position: Lecturer, Arts Administration Program, Teachers College, Columbia University

Katya Ann Maslakowski - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., History - 2022

Advisor: Deborah Cohen

Dissertation: “Men of Violence: Colonial Violence, Counterinsurgency Expertise and the end of the British Empire, 1919-1998”, Education: MA Modern British History Loyola University, MA History of Religions, University of Chicago, Current Position:

Jessica Meyer - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Sociology - 2019

Advisor: Jeremy Freese

Fields: Health & Social Epidemiology, Medical Sociology, Gender, Social Inequality, Work & Occupations, Dissertation: "(Not) Working to Sleep: Employment's Contribution to Gender and Socioeconomic Sleep Differences", Education: M.S., Statistics and M.A., Sociology, Northwestern University, B.A., Sociology and Anthropology, Indiana University, Current Position: Postdoctoral Scholar, Biosocial Training Program, Carolina Population Center, University of North Carolina - Chapel Hill

Jaimie Morse - Cluster Fellow

Ph.D., Sociology - 2018

Advisor: Steven Epstein

Field: Sociology of Science, Medicine, Dissertation:"Technologies of Bearing Witness: The Politics of Knowledge Production, Commemoration, and Memory Formation in the Context of Mass Atrocities", Fellowship: Postdoctoral Fellowship in Public Health at Yale University (2019), Presidential Fellowship, Northwestern University, Current Position: Assistant Professor, Sociology, University of California, Santa Cruz

Saheli Nath - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Sociology/MORS - 2019

Advisor: Brayden King

Dissertation: "Some Rise by Sin and Some by Virtue Fall: Empirical Articles on Socially Responsible Investing in Financial Markets", Current Position: Assistant Professor of Managment in the College of Business at the University of Central Oklahoma

Adam Plaiss - Cluster Fellow

Ph.D., History - 2015

Advisor: Ken Alder

Field: American Technology, Dissertation: "The Rise of Technological Citizenship: Infrastructure in Progressive Era America", Prizes: Co-winner 2010 Romani Prize, Best First-Year Paper “The Creation of the American Road/Map System," 2011-12 L. B. Smith Prize - Best Teaching Assistant

Cassidy Puckett - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Sociology - 2015

Advisor: Jeremy Freese

Fields: Technological Change and Educational, Occupational and Health Inequalities, Dissertation: "The Greek Instinct: Technological Change, Digital Adaptability and Social Inequality, Education: M.A., Education, Stanford University, B.A., American Civilization, Brown University, Current Position: Assistant Professor, Emory University

Jayson Maurice Porter - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., History - 2022

Advisor: Paul Gillingham

Dissertation: "Punitive Engineering: Reform, Revolution, & Reconstruction in Mexico and the United States, 1916-1924”, Education: BA Millsaps University, MA University of Oklahoma, Current Position: Voss Postdoctoral Fellow, Institute for the Environment and Society, Brown University.

Sandra Racek - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Art History - 2023

Advisor: Claudia Swan

Field: European medical imagery from the early modern period.

Adam Syvertsen - Cluster Fellow

Ph.D., English - 2024

Advisor: Julia Stern

Dissertation: "A Light From Nowhere: Utopian Fiction and Politics in the Atlantic World, 1802-1859", Current Position: Visiting Assistant Professor in the English Department at Northwestern Univerity, Instructor for The Odyssey Project/Proyecto Odisea with Illinois Humanities and the University of Illinois-Chicago.

Devin Wiggs - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Sociology - 2024

Advisor: Carol Heimer

DevinWiggs2023@u.northwestern.edu

Dissertation: "Labor's Assets: Unions, Pensions, and Capital Strategies in the American Labor Movement", Current Position: Assistant Professor Cornell University ILR School

Christine Wood - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., Sociology - 2014

Advisor: Charles Camic

Fields: Sociology of Knowledge, Science and Medicine, Dissertation: "Making Gender Matter: Knowledge Ecologies, Contested Research Objects and the Tranjectory of Women's and Gender Studies in American Universities 1970-2010", Education: M.A., Sociology, New School for Social Research, Current Position: Research Associate and Visiting Faculty at Feinberg Medical School, Northwestern University

Guangshuo Yang - Graduate Affiliate

Ph.D., History - 2022

Advisor: Peter J. Carroll

Field: Explores the changing conception of animals and its complex relationship with colonialism, nationalism, and modernity, Dissertation: Between the Animal Kingdom and Modern States: Animal Protectionism and the Transcultural Making of Chinese Modernity.
